content.description: The Yellow Blur has crimpy climbing up the yellow streak with a definite crux at the third bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: The leftmost route on the Imitation Wall. this route sits directly behind the large tree that leans up against the crag.

content.description: Upper Eczema Ridge is a fun and easy sport route that begins left of the wide recess and trends right on the patina that Devil's Head is known for. This shares an anchor with the 2 trad routes to the right and provides an easy way to toprope them if you have not brought any gear to the crag.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Start left of the wide alcove situated on the left side of the Imitation Wall.

content.description: Probably the best trad route on the wall, Rear's Beach climbs the face right of Upper Eczema Ridge, aiming for parallel finger cracks. Expect more patina pulling and face climbing than actual crack climbing on this trad route.
content.protection: Bring up to a #1 Camalot with additional finger pieces and nuts if you want to sew up the parallel cracks. It has a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Climb the face to the right of the large recess and left of a splitter hand crack. This route shares an anchor with the route directly to the left and directly to the right.

content.description: Scamper up pleasing granite past 4 bolts.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: It is the first sport route to the right of the wide/mossy chimney that splits the Imitation Wall.

content.description: Madame G.'s Walrus tackles the splitter hand crack on the left panel of the Imitation Wall. Â For those looking to break into crack climbing, this route provides a fun and safe way to get used to jamming and placing gear.
content.protection: Most people should feel comfortable with a single rack up to a #3 Camalot, but the top does get wide and a #4 can be placed before the anchors. It has a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
It ascends the splitter hand crack to the right of the face climb,

Rear's Beach

. This route shares an anchor with

Rear's Beach

.

content.description: Hairy Intertube is a thought-provoking route with sculpted jugs and dishes.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: It is the farthest right route on the Imitation Wall, beginning all the way downhill from the other routes.

content.description:
Follow a crack with interesting horns and fins protruding from it. The route tends to feel steeper than it is with occasional devious gear placements. At the top, step left to the anchors of

Comet Relief

or right to the anchors of

Central Pillar of Ennui

.
content.protection: A single rack to a #3 Camalot and a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Nestled in between the 2 longest sport routes on the Imitation Wall, Freighter Horn climbs the obvious crack and can use either anchor to the left or right.

content.description: The hardest route on the cliff, Comet Relief tackles the panel between two cracks. You may have to put on blinders to not be tempted to use the cracks, but any way you tackle this route provides you with thin and technical movement on great stone.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: It ascends the obvious face in the middle of both the Imitation Wall and 2 splitter cracks.

content.description: Fun face climbing past 5 bolts culminates in a nice, steep finish.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: The Imitation Wall is split down the middle by a large, mossy chimney. This route climbs the pillar just left of the chimney.

content.description: A series of discontinuous cracks arc slightly leftwards. Follow the cracks past horns and juggy patina.
content.protection: A single rack to a #3 Camalot and a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Bare Buttress is the first route to the right of the wide/mossy chimney that splits the Imitation Wall
